description: A former government research facility island split between fire and ice, used by Caesar Clown for illegal experiments.

keyEvents.title: Island Cut in Half by Law
keyEvents.description: Law creates a massive Room and performs a slash that literally cuts the entire laboratory facility and surrounding mountains in half.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the incredible scale of Law's abilities and causes the facility to begin collapsing.

keyEvents.title: Facility Continues Collapsing
keyEvents.description: The research facility continues to destabilize and collapse following Law's bisection and the defeats of Vergo and Caesar.
keyEvents.significance: Represents the end of Caesar's operations and creates urgency for evacuation.

statusHistory.reason: Facility cut in half by Law and collapsing from structural damage

name.japanese: パンクハザード R-66棟

description: A building within the Punk Hazard facility where Luffy's battle with Caesar Clown takes place.

keyEvents.title: Caesar Merges with Shinokuni
keyEvents.description: Caesar absorbs the deadly Shinokuni poison gas and transforms into a massive gas monster in this building.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Caesar makes his last stand against Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Defeats Caesar
keyEvents.description: Luffy defeats Caesar with his Grizzly Magnum attack, sending him crashing through the walls.
keyEvents.significance: The climactic battle conclusion takes place in this building.

statusHistory.reason: Building flooded with Shinokuni gas and damaged by Luffy's attack

description: The secret room where SAD, the key ingredient for artificial Devil Fruits (SMILE), is manufactured. Located deep within the Punk Hazard facility.

keyEvents.title: Law Defeats Vergo
keyEvents.description: Law completely dismembers Vergo and cuts him in half one final time in the SAD production room.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Law achieves his revenge against Vergo.

statusHistory.reason: Room destroyed by Law before he left, as part of the facility bisection
